data RESTError :: *
ns :: Text
data NodeSnapshot

-- | <a>NodeSnapshot</a> constructor.
--   
--   The fields accessible through corresponding lenses are:
--   
--   <ul>
--   <li><a>nsCacheNodeCreateTime</a> <tt>::</tt> <a>Maybe</a>

-- | The date and time when the cache node was created in the source cache
--   cluster.
nsCacheNodeCreateTime :: Lens' NodeSnapshot (Maybe UTCTime)

-- | The cache node identifier for the node in the source cache cluster.
nsCacheNodeId :: Lens' NodeSnapshot (Maybe Text)

-- | The size of the cache on the source cache node.
nsCacheSize :: Lens' NodeSnapshot (Maybe Text)

-- | The date and time when the source node's metadata and cache data set
--   was obtained for the snapshot.
nsSnapshotCreateTime :: Lens' NodeSnapshot (Maybe UTCTime)
data Snapshot

-- | <a>Snapshot</a> constructor.
--   
--   The fields accessible through corresponding lenses are:
--   
--   <ul>
--   <li><a>sAutoMinorVersionUpgrade</a> <tt>::</tt> <a>Maybe</a>
--   <a>Bool</a></li>

--   <a>UTCTime</a></li>
--   <li><a>sCacheClusterId</a> <tt>::</tt> <a>Maybe</a> <a>Text</a></li>
--   <li><a>sCacheNodeType</a> <tt>::</tt> <a>Maybe</a> <a>Text</a></li>
--   <li><a>sCacheParameterGroupName</a> <tt>::</tt> <a>Maybe</a>
--   <a>Text</a></li>
--   <li><a>sCacheSubnetGroupName</a> <tt>::</tt> <a>Maybe</a>
--   <a>Text</a></li>
--   <li><a>sEngine</a> <tt>::</tt> <a>Maybe</a> <a>Text</a></li>
--   <li><a>sEngineVersion</a> <tt>::</tt> <a>Maybe</a> <a>Text</a></li>
--   <li><a>sNodeSnapshots</a> <tt>::</tt> [<a>NodeSnapshot</a>]</li>
--   <li><a>sNumCacheNodes</a> <tt>::</tt> <a>Maybe</a> <a>Int</a></li>
--   <li><a>sPort</a> <tt>::</tt> <a>Maybe</a> <a>Int</a></li>
--   <li><a>sPreferredAvailabilityZone</a> <tt>::</tt> <a>Maybe</a>
--   <a>Text</a></li>
--   <li><a>sPreferredMaintenanceWindow</a> <tt>::</tt> <a>Maybe</a>
--   <a>Text</a></li>
--   <li><a>sSnapshotName</a> <tt>::</tt> <a>Maybe</a> <a>Text</a></li>
--   <li><a>sSnapshotRetentionLimit</a> <tt>::</tt> <a>Maybe</a>
--   <a>Int</a></li>
--   <li><a>sSnapshotSource</a> <tt>::</tt> <a>Maybe</a> <a>Text</a></li>
--   <li><a>sSnapshotStatus</a> <tt>::</tt> <a>Maybe</a> <a>Text</a></li>
--   <li><a>sSnapshotWindow</a> <tt>::</tt> <a>Maybe</a> <a>Text</a></li>
--   <li><a>sTopicArn</a> <tt>::</tt> <a>Maybe</a> <a>Text</a></li>
--   <li><a>sVpcId</a> <tt>::</tt> <a>Maybe</a> <a>Text</a></li>
--   </ul>
snapshot :: Snapshot

-- | This parameter is currently disabled.
sAutoMinorVersionUpgrade :: Lens' Snapshot (Maybe Bool)

-- | The date and time when the source cache cluster was created.
sCacheClusterCreateTime :: Lens' Snapshot (Maybe UTCTime)

-- | The user-supplied identifier of the source cache cluster.
sCacheClusterId :: Lens' Snapshot (Maybe Text)

-- | The name of the compute and memory capacity node type for the source
--   cache cluster.
--   
--   Valid node types are as follows:
--   
--   General purpose: Current generation: 'cache.t2.micro',
--   'cache.t2.small', 'cache.t2.medium', 'cache.m3.medium',
--   'cache.m3.large', 'cache.m3.xlarge', 'cache.m3.2xlarge' Previous
--   generation: 'cache.t1.micro', 'cache.m1.small', 'cache.m1.medium',
--   'cache.m1.large', 'cache.m1.xlarge' Compute optimized:
--   'cache.c1.xlarge' Memory optimized Current generation:
--   'cache.r3.large', 'cache.r3.xlarge', 'cache.r3.2xlarge',
--   'cache.r3.4xlarge', 'cache.r3.8xlarge' Previous generation:
--   'cache.m2.xlarge', 'cache.m2.2xlarge', 'cache.m2.4xlarge' Notes:
--   
--   All t2 instances are created in an Amazon Virtual Private Cloud (VPC).
--   Redis backup/restore is not supported for t2 instances. Redis
--   Append-only files (AOF) functionality is not supported for t1 or t2
--   instances. For a complete listing of cache node types and
--   specifications, see <a>Amazon ElastiCache Product Features and
--   Details</a> and <a>Cache NodeType-Specific Parameters for
--   Memcached</a> or <a>Cache Node Type-Specific Parametersfor Redis</a>.
sCacheNodeType :: Lens' Snapshot (Maybe Text)

-- | The cache parameter group that is associated with the source cache
--   cluster.
sCacheParameterGroupName :: Lens' Snapshot (Maybe Text)

-- | The name of the cache subnet group associated with the source cache
--   cluster.
sCacheSubnetGroupName :: Lens' Snapshot (Maybe Text)

-- | The name of the cache engine (<i>memcached</i> or <i>redis</i>) used
--   by the source cache cluster.
sEngine :: Lens' Snapshot (Maybe Text)

-- | The version of the cache engine version that is used by the source
--   cache cluster.
sEngineVersion :: Lens' Snapshot (Maybe Text)

-- | A list of the cache nodes in the source cache cluster.
sNodeSnapshots :: Lens' Snapshot [NodeSnapshot]

-- | The number of cache nodes in the source cache cluster.
--   
--   For clusters running Redis, this value must be 1. For clusters running
--   Memcached, this value must be between 1 and 20.
sNumCacheNodes :: Lens' Snapshot (Maybe Int)

-- | The port number used by each cache nodes in the source cache cluster.
sPort :: Lens' Snapshot (Maybe Int)

-- | The name of the Availability Zone in which the source cache cluster is
--   located.
sPreferredAvailabilityZone :: Lens' Snapshot (Maybe Text)

-- | Specifies the weekly time range during which maintenance on the cache
--   cluster is performed. It is specified as a range in the format
--   ddd:hh24:mi-ddd:hh24:mi (24H Clock UTC). The minimum maintenance
--   window is a 60 minute period. Valid values for <tt>ddd</tt> are:
--   
--   <tt>sun</tt> <tt>mon</tt> <tt>tue</tt> <tt>wed</tt> <tt>thu</tt>
--   <tt>fri</tt> <tt>sat</tt> Example: 'sun:05:00-sun:09:00'
sPreferredMaintenanceWindow :: Lens' Snapshot (Maybe Text)

-- | The name of a snapshot. For an automatic snapshot, the name is
--   system-generated; for a manual snapshot, this is the user-provided
--   name.
sSnapshotName :: Lens' Snapshot (Maybe Text)

-- | For an automatic snapshot, the number of days for which ElastiCache
--   will retain the snapshot before deleting it.
--   
--   For manual snapshots, this field reflects the
--   <i>SnapshotRetentionLimit</i> for the source cache cluster when the
--   snapshot was created. This field is otherwise ignored: Manual
--   snapshots do not expire, and can only be deleted using the
--   <i>DeleteSnapshot</i> action.
--   
--   Important If the value of SnapshotRetentionLimit is set to zero (0),
--   backups are turned off.
sSnapshotRetentionLimit :: Lens' Snapshot (Maybe Int)

-- | Indicates whether the snapshot is from an automatic backup
--   (<tt>automated</tt>) or was created manually (<tt>manual</tt>).
sSnapshotSource :: Lens' Snapshot (Maybe Text)

-- | The status of the snapshot. Valid values: <tt>creating</tt> |
--   <tt>available</tt> | <tt>restoring</tt> | <tt>copying</tt> |
--   <tt>deleting</tt>.
sSnapshotStatus :: Lens' Snapshot (Maybe Text)

-- | The daily time range during which ElastiCache takes daily snapshots of
--   the source cache cluster.
sSnapshotWindow :: Lens' Snapshot (Maybe Text)

-- | The Amazon Resource Name (ARN) for the topic used by the source cache
--   cluster for publishing notifications.
sTopicArn :: Lens' Snapshot (Maybe Text)

-- | The Amazon Virtual Private Cloud identifier (VPC ID) of the cache
--   subnet group for the source cache cluster.
sVpcId :: Lens' Snapshot (Maybe Text)
data Event

event :: Event

eMessage :: Lens' Event (Maybe Text)

--   occurred at the cache cluster level, the identifier would be the name

eSourceIdentifier :: Lens' Event (Maybe Text)

--   group, a security group, etc.
eSourceType :: Lens' Event (Maybe SourceType)
data NodeGroup

-- | <a>NodeGroup</a> constructor.

--   </ul>
nodeGroup :: NodeGroup

-- | The identifier for the node group. A replication group contains only
--   one node group; therefore, the node group ID is 0001.
ngNodeGroupId :: Lens' NodeGroup (Maybe Text)

-- | A list containing information about individual nodes within the node
--   group.

--   <i>available</i>, etc.
ngStatus :: Lens' NodeGroup (Maybe Text)

data ReservedCacheNode

-- | <a>ReservedCacheNode</a> constructor.
--   
--   The fields accessible through corresponding lenses are:
--   
--   <ul>

--   <li><a>rcnOfferingType</a> <tt>::</tt> <a>Maybe</a> <a>Text</a></li>
--   <li><a>rcnProductDescription</a> <tt>::</tt> <a>Maybe</a>
--   <a>Text</a></li>
--   <li><a>rcnRecurringCharges</a> <tt>::</tt>
--   [<a>RecurringCharge</a>]</li>
--   <li><a>rcnReservedCacheNodeId</a> <tt>::</tt> <a>Maybe</a>
--   <a>Text</a></li>
--   <li><a>rcnReservedCacheNodesOfferingId</a> <tt>::</tt> <a>Maybe</a>
--   <a>Text</a></li>
--   <li><a>rcnStartTime</a> <tt>::</tt> <a>Maybe</a> <a>UTCTime</a></li>
--   <li><a>rcnState</a> <tt>::</tt> <a>Maybe</a> <a>Text</a></li>
--   <li><a>rcnUsagePrice</a> <tt>::</tt> <a>Maybe</a> <a>Double</a></li>
--   </ul>
reservedCacheNode :: ReservedCacheNode

-- | The number of cache nodes that have been reserved.
rcnCacheNodeCount :: Lens' ReservedCacheNode (Maybe Int)

-- | The cache node type for the reserved cache nodes.
--   
--   Valid node types are as follows:
--   
--   General purpose: Current generation: 'cache.t2.micro',
--   'cache.t2.small', 'cache.t2.medium', 'cache.m3.medium',
--   'cache.m3.large', 'cache.m3.xlarge', 'cache.m3.2xlarge' Previous
--   generation: 'cache.t1.micro', 'cache.m1.small', 'cache.m1.medium',
--   'cache.m1.large', 'cache.m1.xlarge' Compute optimized:
--   'cache.c1.xlarge' Memory optimized Current generation:
--   'cache.r3.large', 'cache.r3.xlarge', 'cache.r3.2xlarge',
--   'cache.r3.4xlarge', 'cache.r3.8xlarge' Previous generation:
--   'cache.m2.xlarge', 'cache.m2.2xlarge', 'cache.m2.4xlarge' Notes:
--   
--   All t2 instances are created in an Amazon Virtual Private Cloud (VPC).
--   Redis backup/restore is not supported for t2 instances. Redis
--   Append-only files (AOF) functionality is not supported for t1 or t2
--   instances. For a complete listing of cache node types and
--   specifications, see <a>Amazon ElastiCache Product Features and
--   Details</a> and <a>Cache NodeType-Specific Parameters for
--   Memcached</a> or <a>Cache Node Type-Specific Parametersfor Redis</a>.
rcnCacheNodeType :: Lens' ReservedCacheNode (Maybe Text)

-- | The duration of the reservation in seconds.
rcnDuration :: Lens' ReservedCacheNode (Maybe Int)

-- | The fixed price charged for this reserved cache node.
rcnFixedPrice :: Lens' ReservedCacheNode (Maybe Double)

-- | The offering type of this reserved cache node.
rcnOfferingType :: Lens' ReservedCacheNode (Maybe Text)

-- | The description of the reserved cache node.
rcnProductDescription :: Lens' ReservedCacheNode (Maybe Text)

-- | The recurring price charged to run this reserved cache node.
rcnRecurringCharges :: Lens' ReservedCacheNode [RecurringCharge]

-- | The unique identifier for the reservation.
rcnReservedCacheNodeId :: Lens' ReservedCacheNode (Maybe Text)

-- | The offering identifier.
rcnReservedCacheNodesOfferingId :: Lens' ReservedCacheNode (Maybe Text)

-- | The time the reservation started.
rcnStartTime :: Lens' ReservedCacheNode (Maybe UTCTime)

-- | The state of the reserved cache node.
rcnState :: Lens' ReservedCacheNode (Maybe Text)

-- | The hourly price charged for this reserved cache node.
rcnUsagePrice :: Lens' ReservedCacheNode (Maybe Double)

--   <li><a>ccSecurityGroups</a> <tt>::</tt>
--   [<a>SecurityGroupMembership</a>]</li>
--   <li><a>ccSnapshotRetentionLimit</a> <tt>::</tt> <a>Maybe</a>
--   <a>Int</a></li>
--   <li><a>ccSnapshotWindow</a> <tt>::</tt> <a>Maybe</a> <a>Text</a></li>
--   </ul>
cacheCluster :: CacheCluster

-- | This parameter is currently disabled.
ccAutoMinorVersionUpgrade :: Lens' CacheCluster (Maybe Bool)

-- | The date and time when the cache cluster was created.
ccCacheClusterCreateTime :: Lens' CacheCluster (Maybe UTCTime)

-- | The user-supplied identifier of the cache cluster. This identifier is
--   a unique key that identifies a cache cluster.
ccCacheClusterId :: Lens' CacheCluster (Maybe Text)

-- | The current state of this cache cluster, one of the following values:
--   <i>available</i>, <i>creating</i>, <i>deleted</i>, <i>deleting</i>,
--   <i>incompatible-network</i>, <i>modifying</i>, <i>rebootingcache
--   cluster nodes</i>, <i>restore-failed</i>, or <i>snapshotting</i>.
ccCacheClusterStatus :: Lens' CacheCluster (Maybe Text)

-- | The name of the compute and memory capacity node type for the cache
--   cluster.
--   
--   Valid node types are as follows:
--   
--   General purpose: Current generation: 'cache.t2.micro',
--   'cache.t2.small', 'cache.t2.medium', 'cache.m3.medium',
--   'cache.m3.large', 'cache.m3.xlarge', 'cache.m3.2xlarge' Previous
--   generation: 'cache.t1.micro', 'cache.m1.small', 'cache.m1.medium',
--   'cache.m1.large', 'cache.m1.xlarge' Compute optimized:
--   'cache.c1.xlarge' Memory optimized Current generation:
--   'cache.r3.large', 'cache.r3.xlarge', 'cache.r3.2xlarge',
--   'cache.r3.4xlarge', 'cache.r3.8xlarge' Previous generation:
--   'cache.m2.xlarge', 'cache.m2.2xlarge', 'cache.m2.4xlarge' Notes:
--   
--   All t2 instances are created in an Amazon Virtual Private Cloud (VPC).
--   Redis backup/restore is not supported for t2 instances. Redis
--   Append-only files (AOF) functionality is not supported for t1 or t2
--   instances. For a complete listing of cache node types and
--   specifications, see <a>Amazon ElastiCache Product Features and
--   Details</a> and <a>Cache NodeType-Specific Parameters for
--   Memcached</a> or <a>Cache Node Type-Specific Parametersfor Redis</a>.
ccCacheNodeType :: Lens' CacheCluster (Maybe Text)

-- | A list of cache nodes that are members of the cache cluster.
ccCacheNodes :: Lens' CacheCluster [CacheNode]
ccCacheParameterGroup :: Lens' CacheCluster (Maybe CacheParameterGroupStatus)

-- | A list of cache security group elements, composed of name and status
--   sub-elements.
ccCacheSecurityGroups :: Lens' CacheCluster [CacheSecurityGroupMembership]

-- | The name of the cache subnet group associated with the cache cluster.
ccCacheSubnetGroupName :: Lens' CacheCluster (Maybe Text)

-- | The URL of the web page where you can download the latest ElastiCache
--   client library.
ccClientDownloadLandingPage :: Lens' CacheCluster (Maybe Text)
ccConfigurationEndpoint :: Lens' CacheCluster (Maybe Endpoint)

-- | The name of the cache engine (<i>memcached</i> or <i>redis</i>) to be
--   used for this cache cluster.
ccEngine :: Lens' CacheCluster (Maybe Text)

-- | The version of the cache engine version that is used in this cache
--   cluster.
ccEngineVersion :: Lens' CacheCluster (Maybe Text)
ccNotificationConfiguration :: Lens' CacheCluster (Maybe NotificationConfiguration)

-- | The number of cache nodes in the cache cluster.
--   
--   For clusters running Redis, this value must be 1. For clusters running
--   Memcached, this value must be between 1 and 20.
ccNumCacheNodes :: Lens' CacheCluster (Maybe Int)
ccPendingModifiedValues :: Lens' CacheCluster (Maybe PendingModifiedValues)

-- | The name of the Availability Zone in which the cache cluster is
--   located or <a>Multiple</a> if the cache nodes are located in different
--   Availability Zones.
ccPreferredAvailabilityZone :: Lens' CacheCluster (Maybe Text)

-- | Specifies the weekly time range during which maintenance on the cache
--   cluster is performed. It is specified as a range in the format
--   ddd:hh24:mi-ddd:hh24:mi (24H Clock UTC). The minimum maintenance
--   window is a 60 minute period. Valid values for <tt>ddd</tt> are:
--   
--   <tt>sun</tt> <tt>mon</tt> <tt>tue</tt> <tt>wed</tt> <tt>thu</tt>
--   <tt>fri</tt> <tt>sat</tt> Example: 'sun:05:00-sun:09:00'
ccPreferredMaintenanceWindow :: Lens' CacheCluster (Maybe Text)

-- | The replication group to which this cache cluster belongs. If this
--   field is empty, the cache cluster is not associated with any
--   replication group.
ccReplicationGroupId :: Lens' CacheCluster (Maybe Text)

-- | A list of VPC Security Groups associated with the cache cluster.
ccSecurityGroups :: Lens' CacheCluster [SecurityGroupMembership]

-- | The number of days for which ElastiCache will retain automatic cache
--   cluster snapshots before deleting them. For example, if you set
--   <i>SnapshotRetentionLimit</i> to 5, then a snapshot that was taken
--   today will be retained for 5 days before being deleted.
--   
--   Important If the value of SnapshotRetentionLimit is set to zero (0),
--   backups are turned off.
ccSnapshotRetentionLimit :: Lens' CacheCluster (Maybe Int)

-- | The daily time range (in UTC) during which ElastiCache will begin
--   taking a daily snapshot of your cache cluster.
--   
--   Example: '05:00-09:00'
ccSnapshotWindow :: Lens' CacheCluster (Maybe Text)
data EngineDefaults

-- | <a>EngineDefaults</a> constructor.
--   
--   The fields accessible through corresponding lenses are:
--   
--   <ul>
--   <li><a>edCacheNodeTypeSpecificParameters</a> <tt>::</tt>
--   [<a>CacheNodeTypeSpecificParameter</a>]</li>
--   <li><a>edCacheParameterGroupFamily</a> <tt>::</tt> <a>Maybe</a>
--   <a>Text</a></li>
--   <li><a>edMarker</a> <tt>::</tt> <a>Maybe</a> <a>Text</a></li>
--   <li><a>edParameters</a> <tt>::</tt> [<a>Parameter</a>]</li>
--   </ul>
engineDefaults :: EngineDefaults

-- | A list of parameters specific to a particular cache node type. Each
--   element in the list contains detailed information about one parameter.
edCacheNodeTypeSpecificParameters :: Lens' EngineDefaults [CacheNodeTypeSpecificParameter]

-- | Specifies the name of the cache parameter group family to which the
--   engine default parameters apply.
edCacheParameterGroupFamily :: Lens' EngineDefaults (Maybe Text)

-- | Provides an identifier to allow retrieval of paginated results.
edMarker :: Lens' EngineDefaults (Maybe Text)

-- | Contains a list of engine default parameters.
edParameters :: Lens' EngineDefaults [Parameter]
data CacheParameterGroupStatus

-- | <a>CacheParameterGroupStatus</a> constructor.
--   
--   The fields accessible through corresponding lenses are:
--   
--   <ul>
--   <li><a>cpgsCacheNodeIdsToReboot</a> <tt>::</tt> [<a>Text</a>]</li>
--   <li><a>cpgsCacheParameterGroupName</a> <tt>::</tt> <a>Maybe</a>
--   <a>Text</a></li>
--   <li><a>cpgsParameterApplyStatus</a> <tt>::</tt> <a>Maybe</a>
--   <a>Text</a></li>
--   </ul>
cacheParameterGroupStatus :: CacheParameterGroupStatus

-- | A list of the cache node IDs which need to be rebooted for parameter
--   changes to be applied. A node ID is a numeric identifier (0001, 0002,
--   etc.).
cpgsCacheNodeIdsToReboot :: Lens' CacheParameterGroupStatus [Text]

-- | The name of the cache parameter group.
cpgsCacheParameterGroupName :: Lens' CacheParameterGroupStatus (Maybe Text)

-- | The status of parameter updates.
cpgsParameterApplyStatus :: Lens' CacheParameterGroupStatus (Maybe Text)
data CacheNode

-- | <a>CacheNode</a> constructor.
--   
--   The fields accessible through corresponding lenses are:
--   
--   <ul>
--   <li><a>cnCacheNodeCreateTime</a> <tt>::</tt> <a>Maybe</a>
--   <a>UTCTime</a></li>
--   <li><a>cnCacheNodeId</a> <tt>::</tt> <a>Maybe</a> <a>Text</a></li>
--   <li><a>cnCacheNodeStatus</a> <tt>::</tt> <a>Maybe</a> <a>Text</a></li>
--   <li><a>cnCustomerAvailabilityZone</a> <tt>::</tt> <a>Maybe</a>
--   <a>Text</a></li>
--   <li><a>cnEndpoint</a> <tt>::</tt> <a>Maybe</a> <a>Endpoint</a></li>
--   <li><a>cnParameterGroupStatus</a> <tt>::</tt> <a>Maybe</a>
--   <a>Text</a></li>
--   <li><a>cnSourceCacheNodeId</a> <tt>::</tt> <a>Maybe</a>
--   <a>Text</a></li>
--   </ul>
cacheNode :: CacheNode

-- | The date and time when the cache node was created.
cnCacheNodeCreateTime :: Lens' CacheNode (Maybe UTCTime)

-- | The cache node identifier. A node ID is a numeric identifier (0001,
--   0002, etc.). The combination of cluster ID and node ID uniquely
--   identifies every cache node used in a customer's AWS account.
cnCacheNodeId :: Lens' CacheNode (Maybe Text)

-- | The current state of this cache node.
cnCacheNodeStatus :: Lens' CacheNode (Maybe Text)

-- | The Availability Zone where this node was created and now resides.
cnCustomerAvailabilityZone :: Lens' CacheNode (Maybe Text)

-- | The hostname for connecting to this cache node.
cnEndpoint :: Lens' CacheNode (Maybe Endpoint)

-- | The status of the parameter group applied to this cache node.
cnParameterGroupStatus :: Lens' CacheNode (Maybe Text)

-- | The ID of the primary node to which this read replica node is
--   synchronized. If this field is empty, then this node is not associated
--   with a primary cache cluster.
cnSourceCacheNodeId :: Lens' CacheNode (Maybe Text)
data CacheSecurityGroupMembership

-- | <a>CacheSecurityGroupMembership</a> constructor.
--   
--   The fields accessible through corresponding lenses are:
--   
--   <ul>
--   <li><a>csgmCacheSecurityGroupName</a> <tt>::</tt> <a>Maybe</a>
--   <a>Text</a></li>
--   <li><a>csgmStatus</a> <tt>::</tt> <a>Maybe</a> <a>Text</a></li>
--   </ul>
cacheSecurityGroupMembership :: CacheSecurityGroupMembership

-- | The name of the cache security group.
csgmCacheSecurityGroupName :: Lens' CacheSecurityGroupMembership (Maybe Text)

-- | The membership status in the cache security group. The status changes
--   when a cache security group is modified, or when the cache security
--   groups assigned to a cache cluster are modified.
csgmStatus :: Lens' CacheSecurityGroupMembership (Maybe Text)
data AvailabilityZone

-- | <a>AvailabilityZone</a> constructor.
--   
--   The fields accessible through corresponding lenses are:
--   
--   <ul>
--   <li><a>azName</a> <tt>::</tt> <a>Maybe</a> <a>Text</a></li>
--   </ul>
availabilityZone :: AvailabilityZone

-- | The name of the Availability Zone.
azName :: Lens' AvailabilityZone (Maybe Text)
data NodeGroupMember

-- | <a>NodeGroupMember</a> constructor.
--   
--   The fields accessible through corresponding lenses are:
--   
--   <ul>
--   <li><a>ngmCacheClusterId</a> <tt>::</tt> <a>Maybe</a> <a>Text</a></li>
--   <li><a>ngmCacheNodeId</a> <tt>::</tt> <a>Maybe</a> <a>Text</a></li>
--   <li><a>ngmCurrentRole</a> <tt>::</tt> <a>Maybe</a> <a>Text</a></li>
--   <li><a>ngmPreferredAvailabilityZone</a> <tt>::</tt> <a>Maybe</a>
--   <a>Text</a></li>
--   <li><a>ngmReadEndpoint</a> <tt>::</tt> <a>Maybe</a>
--   <a>Endpoint</a></li>
--   </ul>
nodeGroupMember :: NodeGroupMember

-- | The ID of the cache cluster to which the node belongs.
ngmCacheClusterId :: Lens' NodeGroupMember (Maybe Text)

-- | The ID of the node within its cache cluster. A node ID is a numeric
--   identifier (0001, 0002, etc.).
ngmCacheNodeId :: Lens' NodeGroupMember (Maybe Text)

-- | The role that is currently assigned to the node - <i>primary</i> or
--   <i>replica</i>.
ngmCurrentRole :: Lens' NodeGroupMember (Maybe Text)

-- | The name of the Availability Zone in which the node is located.
ngmPreferredAvailabilityZone :: Lens' NodeGroupMember (Maybe Text)
ngmReadEndpoint :: Lens' NodeGroupMember (Maybe Endpoint)
data CacheParameterGroup

-- | <a>CacheParameterGroup</a> constructor.
--   
--   The fields accessible through corresponding lenses are:
--   
--   <ul>
--   <li><a>cpgCacheParameterGroupFamily</a> <tt>::</tt> <a>Maybe</a>
--   <a>Text</a></li>
--   <li><a>cpgCacheParameterGroupName</a> <tt>::</tt> <a>Maybe</a>
--   <a>Text</a></li>
--   <li><a>cpgDescription</a> <tt>::</tt> <a>Maybe</a> <a>Text</a></li>
--   </ul>
cacheParameterGroup :: CacheParameterGroup

-- | The name of the cache parameter group family that this cache parameter
--   group is compatible with.
cpgCacheParameterGroupFamily :: Lens' CacheParameterGroup (Maybe Text)

-- | The name of the cache parameter group.
cpgCacheParameterGroupName :: Lens' CacheParameterGroup (Maybe Text)

-- | The description for this cache parameter group.
cpgDescription :: Lens' CacheParameterGroup (Maybe Text)
data AutomaticFailoverStatus

-- | disabled
AFSDisabled :: AutomaticFailoverStatus

-- | disabling
AFSDisabling :: AutomaticFailoverStatus

-- | enabled
AFSEnabled :: AutomaticFailoverStatus

-- | enabling
AFSEnabling :: AutomaticFailoverStatus
data CacheSecurityGroup

-- | <a>CacheSecurityGroup</a> constructor.
--   
--   The fields accessible through corresponding lenses are:
--   
--   <ul>
--   <li><a>csgCacheSecurityGroupName</a> <tt>::</tt> <a>Maybe</a>
--   <a>Text</a></li>
--   <li><a>csgDescription</a> <tt>::</tt> <a>Maybe</a> <a>Text</a></li>
--   <li><a>csgEC2SecurityGroups</a> <tt>::</tt>
--   [<a>EC2SecurityGroup</a>]</li>
--   <li><a>csgOwnerId</a> <tt>::</tt> <a>Maybe</a> <a>Text</a></li>
--   </ul>
cacheSecurityGroup :: CacheSecurityGroup

-- | The name of the cache security group.
csgCacheSecurityGroupName :: Lens' CacheSecurityGroup (Maybe Text)

-- | The description of the cache security group.
csgDescription :: Lens' CacheSecurityGroup (Maybe Text)

-- | A list of Amazon EC2 security groups that are associated with this
--   cache security group.
csgEC2SecurityGroups :: Lens' CacheSecurityGroup [EC2SecurityGroup]

-- | The AWS account ID of the cache security group owner.
csgOwnerId :: Lens' CacheSecurityGroup (Maybe Text)
data CacheNodeTypeSpecificParameter

-- | <a>CacheNodeTypeSpecificParameter</a> constructor.
--   
--   The fields accessible through corresponding lenses are:
--   
--   <ul>
--   <li><a>cntspAllowedValues</a> <tt>::</tt> <a>Maybe</a>
--   <a>Text</a></li>
--   <li><a>cntspCacheNodeTypeSpecificValues</a> <tt>::</tt>
--   [<a>CacheNodeTypeSpecificValue</a>]</li>
--   <li><a>cntspDataType</a> <tt>::</tt> <a>Maybe</a> <a>Text</a></li>
--   <li><a>cntspDescription</a> <tt>::</tt> <a>Maybe</a> <a>Text</a></li>
--   <li><a>cntspIsModifiable</a> <tt>::</tt> <a>Maybe</a> <a>Bool</a></li>
--   <li><a>cntspMinimumEngineVersion</a> <tt>::</tt> <a>Maybe</a>
--   <a>Text</a></li>
--   <li><a>cntspParameterName</a> <tt>::</tt> <a>Maybe</a>
--   <a>Text</a></li>
--   <li><a>cntspSource</a> <tt>::</tt> <a>Maybe</a> <a>Text</a></li>
--   </ul>
cacheNodeTypeSpecificParameter :: CacheNodeTypeSpecificParameter

-- | The valid range of values for the parameter.
cntspAllowedValues :: Lens' CacheNodeTypeSpecificParameter (Maybe Text)

-- | A list of cache node types and their corresponding values for this
--   parameter.
cntspCacheNodeTypeSpecificValues :: Lens' CacheNodeTypeSpecificParameter [CacheNodeTypeSpecificValue]

-- | The valid data type for the parameter.
cntspDataType :: Lens' CacheNodeTypeSpecificParameter (Maybe Text)

-- | A description of the parameter.
cntspDescription :: Lens' CacheNodeTypeSpecificParameter (Maybe Text)

-- | Indicates whether (<tt>true</tt>) or not (<tt>false</tt>) the
--   parameter can be modified. Some parameters have security or
--   operational implications that prevent them from being changed.
cntspIsModifiable :: Lens' CacheNodeTypeSpecificParameter (Maybe Bool)

-- | The earliest cache engine version to which the parameter can apply.
cntspMinimumEngineVersion :: Lens' CacheNodeTypeSpecificParameter (Maybe Text)

-- | The name of the parameter.
cntspParameterName :: Lens' CacheNodeTypeSpecificParameter (Maybe Text)

-- | The source of the parameter value.
cntspSource :: Lens' CacheNodeTypeSpecificParameter (Maybe Text)
data AZMode

-- | cross-az
CrossAz :: AZMode

-- | single-az
SingleAz :: AZMode
data CacheEngineVersion

-- | <a>CacheEngineVersion</a> constructor.
--   
--   The fields accessible through corresponding lenses are:
--   
--   <ul>
--   <li><a>cevCacheEngineDescription</a> <tt>::</tt> <a>Maybe</a>
--   <a>Text</a></li>
--   <li><a>cevCacheEngineVersionDescription</a> <tt>::</tt> <a>Maybe</a>
--   <a>Text</a></li>
--   <li><a>cevCacheParameterGroupFamily</a> <tt>::</tt> <a>Maybe</a>
--   <a>Text</a></li>
--   <li><a>cevEngine</a> <tt>::</tt> <a>Maybe</a> <a>Text</a></li>
--   <li><a>cevEngineVersion</a> <tt>::</tt> <a>Maybe</a> <a>Text</a></li>
--   </ul>
cacheEngineVersion :: CacheEngineVersion

-- | The description of the cache engine.
cevCacheEngineDescription :: Lens' CacheEngineVersion (Maybe Text)

-- | The description of the cache engine version.
cevCacheEngineVersionDescription :: Lens' CacheEngineVersion (Maybe Text)

-- | The name of the cache parameter group family associated with this
--   cache engine.
cevCacheParameterGroupFamily :: Lens' CacheEngineVersion (Maybe Text)

-- | The name of the cache engine.
cevEngine :: Lens' CacheEngineVersion (Maybe Text)

-- | The version number of the cache engine.
cevEngineVersion :: Lens' CacheEngineVersion (Maybe Text)
data ReplicationGroup

-- | <a>ReplicationGroup</a> constructor.
--   
--   The fields accessible through corresponding lenses are:
--   
--   <ul>
--   <li><a>rgAutomaticFailover</a> <tt>::</tt> <a>Maybe</a>
--   <a>AutomaticFailoverStatus</a></li>
--   <li><a>rgDescription</a> <tt>::</tt> <a>Maybe</a> <a>Text</a></li>
--   <li><a>rgMemberClusters</a> <tt>::</tt> [<a>Text</a>]</li>
--   <li><a>rgNodeGroups</a> <tt>::</tt> [<a>NodeGroup</a>]</li>
--   <li><a>rgPendingModifiedValues</a> <tt>::</tt> <a>Maybe</a>
--   <a>ReplicationGroupPendingModifiedValues</a></li>
--   <li><a>rgReplicationGroupId</a> <tt>::</tt> <a>Maybe</a>
--   <a>Text</a></li>
--   <li><a>rgSnapshottingClusterId</a> <tt>::</tt> <a>Maybe</a>
--   <a>Text</a></li>
--   <li><a>rgStatus</a> <tt>::</tt> <a>Maybe</a> <a>Text</a></li>
--   </ul>
replicationGroup :: ReplicationGroup

-- | Indicates the status of Multi-AZ for this replication group.
--   
--   ElastiCache Multi-AZ replication groups are not supported on:
--   
--   Redis versions earlier than 2.8.6. T1 and T2 cache node types.
rgAutomaticFailover :: Lens' ReplicationGroup (Maybe AutomaticFailoverStatus)

-- | The description of the replication group.
rgDescription :: Lens' ReplicationGroup (Maybe Text)

-- | The names of all the cache clusters that are part of this replication
--   group.
rgMemberClusters :: Lens' ReplicationGroup [Text]

-- | A single element list with information about the nodes in the
--   replication group.
rgNodeGroups :: Lens' ReplicationGroup [NodeGroup]

-- | A group of settings to be applied to the replication group, either
--   immediately or during the next maintenance window.
rgPendingModifiedValues :: Lens' ReplicationGroup (Maybe ReplicationGroupPendingModifiedValues)

-- | The identifier for the replication group.
rgReplicationGroupId :: Lens' ReplicationGroup (Maybe Text)

-- | The cache cluster ID that is used as the daily snapshot source for the
--   replication group.
rgSnapshottingClusterId :: Lens' ReplicationGroup (Maybe Text)

-- | The current state of this replication group - <i>creating</i>,
--   <i>available</i>, etc.
rgStatus :: Lens' ReplicationGroup (Maybe Text)
data RecurringCharge

-- | <a>RecurringCharge</a> constructor.
--   
--   The fields accessible through corresponding lenses are:
--   
--   <ul>
--   <li><a>rcRecurringChargeAmount</a> <tt>::</tt> <a>Maybe</a>
--   <a>Double</a></li>
--   <li><a>rcRecurringChargeFrequency</a> <tt>::</tt> <a>Maybe</a>
--   <a>Text</a></li>
--   </ul>
recurringCharge :: RecurringCharge

-- | The monetary amount of the recurring charge.
rcRecurringChargeAmount :: Lens' RecurringCharge (Maybe Double)

-- | The frequency of the recurring charge.
rcRecurringChargeFrequency :: Lens' RecurringCharge (Maybe Text)
data ReservedCacheNodesOffering

-- | <a>ReservedCacheNodesOffering</a> constructor.
--   
--   The fields accessible through corresponding lenses are:
--   
--   <ul>
--   <li><a>rcnoCacheNodeType</a> <tt>::</tt> <a>Maybe</a> <a>Text</a></li>
--   <li><a>rcnoDuration</a> <tt>::</tt> <a>Maybe</a> <a>Int</a></li>
--   <li><a>rcnoFixedPrice</a> <tt>::</tt> <a>Maybe</a> <a>Double</a></li>
--   <li><a>rcnoOfferingType</a> <tt>::</tt> <a>Maybe</a> <a>Text</a></li>
--   <li><a>rcnoProductDescription</a> <tt>::</tt> <a>Maybe</a>
--   <a>Text</a></li>
--   <li><a>rcnoRecurringCharges</a> <tt>::</tt>
--   [<a>RecurringCharge</a>]</li>
--   <li><a>rcnoReservedCacheNodesOfferingId</a> <tt>::</tt> <a>Maybe</a>
--   <a>Text</a></li>
--   <li><a>rcnoUsagePrice</a> <tt>::</tt> <a>Maybe</a> <a>Double</a></li>
--   </ul>
reservedCacheNodesOffering :: ReservedCacheNodesOffering

-- | The cache node type for the reserved cache node.
--   
--   Valid node types are as follows:
--   
--   General purpose: Current generation: 'cache.t2.micro',
--   'cache.t2.small', 'cache.t2.medium', 'cache.m3.medium',
--   'cache.m3.large', 'cache.m3.xlarge', 'cache.m3.2xlarge' Previous
--   generation: 'cache.t1.micro', 'cache.m1.small', 'cache.m1.medium',
--   'cache.m1.large', 'cache.m1.xlarge' Compute optimized:
--   'cache.c1.xlarge' Memory optimized Current generation:
--   'cache.r3.large', 'cache.r3.xlarge', 'cache.r3.2xlarge',
--   'cache.r3.4xlarge', 'cache.r3.8xlarge' Previous generation:
--   'cache.m2.xlarge', 'cache.m2.2xlarge', 'cache.m2.4xlarge' Notes:
--   
--   All t2 instances are created in an Amazon Virtual Private Cloud (VPC).
--   Redis backup/restore is not supported for t2 instances. Redis
--   Append-only files (AOF) functionality is not supported for t1 or t2
--   instances. For a complete listing of cache node types and
--   specifications, see <a>Amazon ElastiCache Product Features and
--   Details</a> and <a>Cache NodeType-Specific Parameters for
--   Memcached</a> or <a>Cache Node Type-Specific Parametersfor Redis</a>.
rcnoCacheNodeType :: Lens' ReservedCacheNodesOffering (Maybe Text)

-- | The duration of the offering. in seconds.
rcnoDuration :: Lens' ReservedCacheNodesOffering (Maybe Int)

-- | The fixed price charged for this offering.
rcnoFixedPrice :: Lens' ReservedCacheNodesOffering (Maybe Double)

-- | The offering type.
rcnoOfferingType :: Lens' ReservedCacheNodesOffering (Maybe Text)

-- | The cache engine used by the offering.
rcnoProductDescription :: Lens' ReservedCacheNodesOffering (Maybe Text)

-- | The recurring price charged to run this reserved cache node.
rcnoRecurringCharges :: Lens' ReservedCacheNodesOffering [RecurringCharge]

-- | A unique identifier for the reserved cache node offering.
rcnoReservedCacheNodesOfferingId :: Lens' ReservedCacheNodesOffering (Maybe Text)

-- | The hourly price charged for this offering.
rcnoUsagePrice :: Lens' ReservedCacheNodesOffering (Maybe Double)
data TagListMessage

-- | <a>TagListMessage</a> constructor.
--   
--   The fields accessible through corresponding lenses are:
--   
--   <ul>
--   <li><a>tlmTagList</a> <tt>::</tt> [<a>Tag</a>]</li>
--   </ul>
tagListMessage :: TagListMessage

-- | A list of cost allocation tags as key-value pairs.
tlmTagList :: Lens' TagListMessage [Tag]
data Endpoint

-- | <a>Endpoint</a> constructor.
--   
--   The fields accessible through corresponding lenses are:
--   
--   <ul>
--   <li><a>eAddress</a> <tt>::</tt> <a>Maybe</a> <a>Text</a></li>
--   <li><a>ePort</a> <tt>::</tt> <a>Maybe</a> <a>Int</a></li>
--   </ul>
endpoint :: Endpoint

-- | The DNS hostname of the cache node.
eAddress :: Lens' Endpoint (Maybe Text)

-- | The port number that the cache engine is listening on.
ePort :: Lens' Endpoint (Maybe Int)
data PendingModifiedValues

-- | <a>PendingModifiedValues</a> constructor.
--   
--   The fields accessible through corresponding lenses are:
--   
--   <ul>
--   <li><a>pmvCacheNodeIdsToRemove</a> <tt>::</tt> [<a>Text</a>]</li>
--   <li><a>pmvEngineVersion</a> <tt>::</tt> <a>Maybe</a> <a>Text</a></li>
--   <li><a>pmvNumCacheNodes</a> <tt>::</tt> <a>Maybe</a> <a>Int</a></li>
--   </ul>
pendingModifiedValues :: PendingModifiedValues

-- | A list of cache node IDs that are being removed (or will be removed)
--   from the cache cluster. A node ID is a numeric identifier (0001, 0002,
--   etc.).
pmvCacheNodeIdsToRemove :: Lens' PendingModifiedValues [Text]

-- | The new cache engine version that the cache cluster will run.
pmvEngineVersion :: Lens' PendingModifiedValues (Maybe Text)

-- | The new number of cache nodes for the cache cluster.
--   
--   For clusters running Redis, this value must be 1. For clusters running
--   Memcached, this value must be between 1 and 20.
pmvNumCacheNodes :: Lens' PendingModifiedValues (Maybe Int)
data CacheParameterGroupNameMessage

-- | <a>CacheParameterGroupNameMessage</a> constructor.
--   
--   The fields accessible through corresponding lenses are:
--   
--   <ul>
--   <li><a>cpgnmCacheParameterGroupName</a> <tt>::</tt> <a>Maybe</a>
--   <a>Text</a></li>
--   </ul>
cacheParameterGroupNameMessage :: CacheParameterGroupNameMessage

-- | The name of the cache parameter group.
cpgnmCacheParameterGroupName :: Lens' CacheParameterGroupNameMessage (Maybe Text)
data Parameter

-- | <a>Parameter</a> constructor.
--   
--   The fields accessible through corresponding lenses are:
--   
--   <ul>
--   <li><a>pAllowedValues</a> <tt>::</tt> <a>Maybe</a> <a>Text</a></li>
--   <li><a>pDataType</a> <tt>::</tt> <a>Maybe</a> <a>Text</a></li>
--   <li><a>pDescription</a> <tt>::</tt> <a>Maybe</a> <a>Text</a></li>
--   <li><a>pIsModifiable</a> <tt>::</tt> <a>Maybe</a> <a>Bool</a></li>
--   <li><a>pMinimumEngineVersion</a> <tt>::</tt> <a>Maybe</a>
--   <a>Text</a></li>
--   <li><a>pParameterName</a> <tt>::</tt> <a>Maybe</a> <a>Text</a></li>
--   <li><a>pParameterValue</a> <tt>::</tt> <a>Maybe</a> <a>Text</a></li>
--   <li><a>pSource</a> <tt>::</tt> <a>Maybe</a> <a>Text</a></li>
--   </ul>
parameter :: Parameter

-- | The valid range of values for the parameter.
pAllowedValues :: Lens' Parameter (Maybe Text)

-- | The valid data type for the parameter.
pDataType :: Lens' Parameter (Maybe Text)

-- | A description of the parameter.
pDescription :: Lens' Parameter (Maybe Text)

-- | Indicates whether (<tt>true</tt>) or not (<tt>false</tt>) the
--   parameter can be modified. Some parameters have security or
--   operational implications that prevent them from being changed.
pIsModifiable :: Lens' Parameter (Maybe Bool)

-- | The earliest cache engine version to which the parameter can apply.
pMinimumEngineVersion :: Lens' Parameter (Maybe Text)

-- | The name of the parameter.
pParameterName :: Lens' Parameter (Maybe Text)

-- | The value of the parameter.
pParameterValue :: Lens' Parameter (Maybe Text)

-- | The source of the parameter.
pSource :: Lens' Parameter (Maybe Text)

instance Show NodeSnapshot

instance Read Snapshot
instance Show Snapshot

instance AWSService ElastiCache


-- | The <i>RevokeCacheSecurityGroupIngress</i> action revokes ingress from
--   a cache security group. Use this action to disallow access from an
--   Amazon EC2 security group that had been previously authorized.
--   
--   
--   <a>http://docs.aws.amazon.com/AmazonElastiCache/latest/APIReference/API_RevokeCacheSecurityGroupIngress.html</a>
module Network.AWS.ElastiCache.RevokeCacheSecurityGroupIngress
data RevokeCacheSecurityGroupIngress

-- | <a>RevokeCacheSecurityGroupIngress</a> constructor.
--   
--   The fields accessible through corresponding lenses are:
--   
--   <ul>
--   <li><a>rcsgiCacheSecurityGroupName</a> <tt>::</tt> <a>Text</a></li>
--   <li><a>rcsgiEC2SecurityGroupName</a> <tt>::</tt> <a>Text</a></li>
--   <li><a>rcsgiEC2SecurityGroupOwnerId</a> <tt>::</tt> <a>Text</a></li>
--   </ul>
revokeCacheSecurityGroupIngress :: Text -> Text -> Text -> RevokeCacheSecurityGroupIngress

-- | The name of the cache security group to revoke ingress from.
rcsgiCacheSecurityGroupName :: Lens' RevokeCacheSecurityGroupIngress Text

-- | The name of the Amazon EC2 security group to revoke access from.
rcsgiEC2SecurityGroupName :: Lens' RevokeCacheSecurityGroupIngress Text

-- | The AWS account number of the Amazon EC2 security group owner. Note
--   that this is not the same thing as an AWS access key ID - you must
--   provide a valid AWS account number for this parameter.
rcsgiEC2SecurityGroupOwnerId :: Lens' RevokeCacheSecurityGroupIngress Text
data RevokeCacheSecurityGroupIngressResponse

-- | <a>RevokeCacheSecurityGroupIngressResponse</a> constructor.
--   
--   The fields accessible through corresponding lenses are:
--   
--   <ul>
--   <li><a>rcsgirCacheSecurityGroup</a> <tt>::</tt> <a>Maybe</a>
--   <a>CacheSecurityGroup</a></li>
--   </ul>
revokeCacheSecurityGroupIngressResponse :: RevokeCacheSecurityGroupIngressResponse
rcsgirCacheSecurityGroup :: Lens' RevokeCacheSecurityGroupIngressResponse (Maybe CacheSecurityGroup)
instance Eq RevokeCacheSecurityGroupIngress
instance Ord RevokeCacheSecurityGroupIngress
instance Read RevokeCacheSecurityGroupIngress
instance Show RevokeCacheSecurityGroupIngress
instance Eq RevokeCacheSecurityGroupIngressResponse
instance Read RevokeCacheSecurityGroupIngressResponse
instance Show RevokeCacheSecurityGroupIngressResponse
instance FromXML RevokeCacheSecurityGroupIngressResponse
instance AWSRequest RevokeCacheSecurityGroupIngress
instance ToHeaders RevokeCacheSecurityGroupIngress
instance ToQuery RevokeCacheSecurityGroupIngress
instance ToPath RevokeCacheSecurityGroupIngress


-- | The <i>ResetCacheParameterGroup</i> action modifies the parameters of
--   a cache parameter group to the engine or system default value. You can
--   reset specific parameters by submitting a list of parameter names. To
--   reset the entire cache parameter group, specify the
--   <i>ResetAllParameters</i> and <i>CacheParameterGroupName</i>
--   parameters.
--   
--   
--   <a>http://docs.aws.amazon.com/AmazonElastiCache/latest/APIReference/API_ResetCacheParameterGroup.html</a>
module Network.AWS.ElastiCache.ResetCacheParameterGroup
data ResetCacheParameterGroup

-- | <a>ResetCacheParameterGroup</a> constructor.
--   
--   The fields accessible through corresponding lenses are:
--   
--   <ul>
--   <li><a>rcpgCacheParameterGroupName</a> <tt>::</tt> <a>Text</a></li>
--   <li><a>rcpgParameterNameValues</a> <tt>::</tt>
--   [<a>ParameterNameValue</a>]</li>
--   <li><a>rcpgResetAllParameters</a> <tt>::</tt> <a>Maybe</a>
--   <a>Bool</a></li>
--   </ul>
resetCacheParameterGroup :: Text -> ResetCacheParameterGroup

-- | The name of the cache parameter group to reset.
rcpgCacheParameterGroupName :: Lens' ResetCacheParameterGroup Text

-- | An array of parameter names to be reset. If you are not resetting the
--   entire cache parameter group, you must specify at least one parameter
--   name.
rcpgParameterNameValues :: Lens' ResetCacheParameterGroup [ParameterNameValue]

-- | If <i>true</i>, all parameters in the cache parameter group will be
--   reset to default values. If <i>false</i>, no such action occurs.
--   
--   Valid values: <tt>true</tt> | <tt>false</tt>
rcpgResetAllParameters :: Lens' ResetCacheParameterGroup (Maybe Bool)
data ResetCacheParameterGroupResponse

-- | <a>ResetCacheParameterGroupResponse</a> constructor.
--   
--   The fields accessible through corresponding lenses are:
--   
--   <ul>
--   <li><a>rcpgrCacheParameterGroupName</a> <tt>::</tt> <a>Maybe</a>
--   <a>Text</a></li>
--   </ul>
resetCacheParameterGroupResponse :: ResetCacheParameterGroupResponse

-- | The name of the cache parameter group.
rcpgrCacheParameterGroupName :: Lens' ResetCacheParameterGroupResponse (Maybe Text)
instance Eq ResetCacheParameterGroup
instance Read ResetCacheParameterGroup
instance Show ResetCacheParameterGroup
instance Eq ResetCacheParameterGroupResponse
instance Ord ResetCacheParameterGroupResponse
instance Read ResetCacheParameterGroupResponse
instance Show ResetCacheParameterGroupResponse
instance Monoid ResetCacheParameterGroupResponse
instance FromXML ResetCacheParameterGroupResponse
instance AWSRequest ResetCacheParameterGroup
instance ToHeaders ResetCacheParameterGroup
instance ToQuery ResetCacheParameterGroup
instance ToPath ResetCacheParameterGroup


-- | The <i>RemoveTagsFromResource</i> action removes the tags identified
--   by the <tt>TagKeys</tt> list from the named resource.
--   
--   
--   <a>http://docs.aws.amazon.com/AmazonElastiCache/latest/APIReference/API_RemoveTagsFromResource.html</a>
module Network.AWS.ElastiCache.RemoveTagsFromResource
data RemoveTagsFromResource

-- | <a>RemoveTagsFromResource</a> constructor.
--   
--   The fields accessible through corresponding lenses are:
--   
--   <ul>
--   <li><a>rtfrResourceName</a> <tt>::</tt> <a>Text</a></li>
--   <li><a>rtfrTagKeys</a> <tt>::</tt> [<a>Text</a>]</li>
--   </ul>
removeTagsFromResource :: Text -> RemoveTagsFromResource

-- | The name of the ElastiCache resource from which you want the listed
--   tags removed, for example
--   'arn:aws:elasticache:us-west-2:0123456789:cluster:myCluster'.
rtfrResourceName :: Lens' RemoveTagsFromResource Text

-- | A list of <tt>TagKeys</tt> identifying the tags you want removed from
--   the named resource. For example, 'TagKeys.member.1=Region' removes the
--   cost allocation tag with the key name <tt>Region</tt> from the
--   resource named by the <i>ResourceName</i> parameter.
rtfrTagKeys :: Lens' RemoveTagsFromResource [Text]
data RemoveTagsFromResourceResponse

-- | <a>RemoveTagsFromResourceResponse</a> constructor.
--   
--   The fields accessible through corresponding lenses are:
--   
--   <ul>
--   <li><a>rtfrrTagList</a> <tt>::</tt> [<a>Tag</a>]</li>
--   </ul>
removeTagsFromResourceResponse :: RemoveTagsFromResourceResponse

-- | A list of cost allocation tags as key-value pairs.
rtfrrTagList :: Lens' RemoveTagsFromResourceResponse [Tag]
instance Eq RemoveTagsFromResource
instance Ord RemoveTagsFromResource
instance Read RemoveTagsFromResource
instance Show RemoveTagsFromResource
instance Eq RemoveTagsFromResourceResponse
instance Read RemoveTagsFromResourceResponse
instance Show RemoveTagsFromResourceResponse
instance Monoid RemoveTagsFromResourceResponse
instance Semigroup RemoveTagsFromResourceResponse
instance FromXML RemoveTagsFromResourceResponse
instance AWSRequest RemoveTagsFromResource
instance ToHeaders RemoveTagsFromResource
instance ToQuery RemoveTagsFromResource
instance ToPath RemoveTagsFromResource
instance IsList RemoveTagsFromResourceResponse


-- | The <i>RebootCacheCluster</i> action reboots some, or all, of the
--   cache nodes within a provisioned cache cluster. This API will apply
--   any modified cache parameter groups to the cache cluster. The reboot
--   action takes place as soon as possible, and results in a momentary
--   outage to the cache cluster. During the reboot, the cache cluster
--   status is set to REBOOTING.
--   
--   The reboot causes the contents of the cache (for each cache node being
--   rebooted) to be lost.
--   
--   When the reboot is complete, a cache cluster event is created.
--   
--   
--   <a>http://docs.aws.amazon.com/AmazonElastiCache/latest/APIReference/API_RebootCacheCluster.html</a>
module Network.AWS.ElastiCache.RebootCacheCluster
data RebootCacheCluster

-- | <a>RebootCacheCluster</a> constructor.
--   
--   The fields accessible through corresponding lenses are:
--   
--   <ul>
--   <li><a>rccCacheClusterId</a> <tt>::</tt> <a>Text</a></li>
--   <li><a>rccCacheNodeIdsToReboot</a> <tt>::</tt> [<a>Text</a>]</li>
--   </ul>
rebootCacheCluster :: Text -> RebootCacheCluster

-- | The cache cluster identifier. This parameter is stored as a lowercase
--   string.
rccCacheClusterId :: Lens' RebootCacheCluster Text

-- | A list of cache node IDs to reboot. A node ID is a numeric identifier
--   (0001, 0002, etc.). To reboot an entire cache cluster, specify all of
--   the cache node IDs.
rccCacheNodeIdsToReboot :: Lens' RebootCacheCluster [Text]
data RebootCacheClusterResponse

-- | <a>RebootCacheClusterResponse</a> constructor.
--   
--   The fields accessible through corresponding lenses are:
--   
--   <ul>
--   <li><a>rccrCacheCluster</a> <tt>::</tt> <a>Maybe</a>
--   <a>CacheCluster</a></li>
--   </ul>
rebootCacheClusterResponse :: RebootCacheClusterResponse
rccrCacheCluster :: Lens' RebootCacheClusterResponse (Maybe CacheCluster)
instance Eq RebootCacheCluster
instance Ord RebootCacheCluster
instance Read RebootCacheCluster
instance Show RebootCacheCluster
instance Eq RebootCacheClusterResponse
instance Read RebootCacheClusterResponse
instance Show RebootCacheClusterResponse
instance FromXML RebootCacheClusterResponse
instance AWSRequest RebootCacheCluster
instance ToHeaders RebootCacheCluster
instance ToQuery RebootCacheCluster
instance ToPath RebootCacheCluster


-- | The <i>PurchaseReservedCacheNodesOffering</i> action allows you to
--   purchase a reserved cache node offering.
--   
--   
--   <a>http://docs.aws.amazon.com/AmazonElastiCache/latest/APIReference/API_PurchaseReservedCacheNodesOffering.html</a>
module Network.AWS.ElastiCache.PurchaseReservedCacheNodesOffering
data PurchaseReservedCacheNodesOffering

-- | <a>PurchaseReservedCacheNodesOffering</a> constructor.
--   
--   The fields accessible through corresponding lenses are:
--   
--   <ul>
--   <li><a>prcnoCacheNodeCount</a> <tt>::</tt> <a>Maybe</a>
--   <a>Int</a></li>
--   <li><a>prcnoReservedCacheNodeId</a> <tt>::</tt> <a>Maybe</a>
--   <a>Text</a></li>
--   <li><a>prcnoReservedCacheNodesOfferingId</a> <tt>::</tt>
--   <a>Text</a></li>
--   </ul>
purchaseReservedCacheNodesOffering :: Text -> PurchaseReservedCacheNodesOffering

-- | The number of cache node instances to reserve.
--   
--   Default: '1'
prcnoCacheNodeCount :: Lens' PurchaseReservedCacheNodesOffering (Maybe Int)

-- | A customer-specified identifier to track this reservation.
--   
--   Example: myreservationID
prcnoReservedCacheNodeId :: Lens' PurchaseReservedCacheNodesOffering (Maybe Text)

-- | The ID of the reserved cache node offering to purchase.
--   
--   Example: 438012d3-4052-4cc7-b2e3-8d3372e0e706
prcnoReservedCacheNodesOfferingId :: Lens' PurchaseReservedCacheNodesOffering Text
data PurchaseReservedCacheNodesOfferingResponse

-- | <a>PurchaseReservedCacheNodesOfferingResponse</a> constructor.
--   
--   The fields accessible through corresponding lenses are:
--   
--   <ul>
--   <li><a>prcnorReservedCacheNode</a> <tt>::</tt> <a>Maybe</a>
--   <a>ReservedCacheNode</a></li>
--   </ul>
purchaseReservedCacheNodesOfferingResponse :: PurchaseReservedCacheNodesOfferingResponse
prcnorReservedCacheNode :: Lens' PurchaseReservedCacheNodesOfferingResponse (Maybe ReservedCacheNode)
instance Eq PurchaseReservedCacheNodesOffering
instance Ord PurchaseReservedCacheNodesOffering
instance Read PurchaseReservedCacheNodesOffering
instance Show PurchaseReservedCacheNodesOffering
instance Eq PurchaseReservedCacheNodesOfferingResponse
instance Read PurchaseReservedCacheNodesOfferingResponse
instance Show PurchaseReservedCacheNodesOfferingResponse
instance FromXML PurchaseReservedCacheNodesOfferingResponse
instance AWSRequest PurchaseReservedCacheNodesOffering
instance ToHeaders PurchaseReservedCacheNodesOffering
instance ToQuery PurchaseReservedCacheNodesOffering
instance ToPath PurchaseReservedCacheNodesOffering


-- | The <i>ModifyReplicationGroup</i> action modifies the settings for a
--   replication group.
--   
--   
--   <a>http://docs.aws.amazon.com/AmazonElastiCache/latest/APIReference/API_ModifyReplicationGroup.html</a>
module Network.AWS.ElastiCache.ModifyReplicationGroup
data ModifyReplicationGroup

-- | <a>ModifyReplicationGroup</a> constructor.
--   
--   The fields accessible through corresponding lenses are:
--   
--   <ul>
--   <li><a>mrgApplyImmediately</a> <tt>::</tt> <a>Maybe</a>
--   <a>Bool</a></li>
--   <li><a>mrgAutoMinorVersionUpgrade</a> <tt>::</tt> <a>Maybe</a>
--   <a>Bool</a></li>
--   <li><a>mrgAutomaticFailoverEnabled</a> <tt>::</tt> <a>Maybe</a>
--   <a>Bool</a></li>
--   <li><a>mrgCacheParameterGroupName</a> <tt>::</tt> <a>Maybe</a>
--   <a>Text</a></li>
--   <li><a>mrgCacheSecurityGroupNames</a> <tt>::</tt> [<a>Text</a>]</li>
--   <li><a>mrgEngineVersion</a> <tt>::</tt> <a>Maybe</a> <a>Text</a></li>
--   <li><a>mrgNotificationTopicArn</a> <tt>::</tt> <a>Maybe</a>
--   <a>Text</a></li>
--   <li><a>mrgNotificationTopicStatus</a> <tt>::</tt> <a>Maybe</a>
--   <a>Text</a></li>
--   <li><a>mrgPreferredMaintenanceWindow</a> <tt>::</tt> <a>Maybe</a>
--   <a>Text</a></li>
--   <li><a>mrgPrimaryClusterId</a> <tt>::</tt> <a>Maybe</a>
--   <a>Text</a></li>
--   <li><a>mrgReplicationGroupDescription</a> <tt>::</tt> <a>Maybe</a>
--   <a>Text</a></li>
--   <li><a>mrgReplicationGroupId</a> <tt>::</tt> <a>Text</a></li>
--   <li><a>mrgSecurityGroupIds</a> <tt>::</tt> [<a>Text</a>]</li>
--   <li><a>mrgSnapshotRetentionLimit</a> <tt>::</tt> <a>Maybe</a>
--   <a>Int</a></li>
--   <li><a>mrgSnapshotWindow</a> <tt>::</tt> <a>Maybe</a> <a>Text</a></li>
--   <li><a>mrgSnapshottingClusterId</a> <tt>::</tt> <a>Maybe</a>
--   <a>Text</a></li>
--   </ul>
modifyReplicationGroup :: Text -> ModifyReplicationGroup

-- | If <tt>true</tt>, this parameter causes the modifications in this
--   request and any pending modifications to be applied, asynchronously
--   and as soon as possible, regardless of the
--   <i>PreferredMaintenanceWindow</i> setting for the replication group.
--   
--   If <tt>false</tt>, then changes to the nodes in the replication group
--   are applied on the next maintenance reboot, or the next failure
--   reboot, whichever occurs first.
--   
--   Valid values: <tt>true</tt> | <tt>false</tt>
--   
--   Default: <tt>false</tt>
mrgApplyImmediately :: Lens' ModifyReplicationGroup (Maybe Bool)

-- | This parameter is currently disabled.
mrgAutoMinorVersionUpgrade :: Lens' ModifyReplicationGroup (Maybe Bool)

-- | Whether a read replica will be automatically promoted to read/write
--   primary if the existing primary encounters a failure.
--   
--   Valid values: <tt>true</tt> | <tt>false</tt>
--   
--   ElastiCache Multi-AZ replication groups are not supported on:
--   
--   Redis versions earlier than 2.8.6. T1 and T2 cache node types.
mrgAutomaticFailoverEnabled :: Lens' ModifyReplicationGroup (Maybe Bool)

-- | The name of the cache parameter group to apply to all of the clusters
--   in this replication group. This change is asynchronously applied as
--   soon as possible for parameters when the <i>ApplyImmediately</i>
--   parameter is specified as <i>true</i> for this request.
mrgCacheParameterGroupName :: Lens' ModifyReplicationGroup (Maybe Text)

-- | A list of cache security group names to authorize for the clusters in
--   this replication group. This change is asynchronously applied as soon
--   as possible.
--   
--   This parameter can be used only with replication group containing
--   cache clusters running outside of an Amazon Virtual Private Cloud
--   (VPC).
--   
--   Constraints: Must contain no more than 255 alphanumeric characters.
--   Must not be <a>Default</a>.
mrgCacheSecurityGroupNames :: Lens' ModifyReplicationGroup [Text]

-- | The upgraded version of the cache engine to be run on the cache
--   clusters in the replication group.
mrgEngineVersion :: Lens' ModifyReplicationGroup (Maybe Text)

-- | The Amazon Resource Name (ARN) of the Amazon SNS topic to which
--   notifications will be sent.
--   
--   The Amazon SNS topic owner must be same as the replication group
--   owner.
mrgNotificationTopicArn :: Lens' ModifyReplicationGroup (Maybe Text)

-- | The status of the Amazon SNS notification topic for the replication
--   group. Notifications are sent only if the status is <i>active</i>.
--   
--   Valid values: <tt>active</tt> | <tt>inactive</tt>
mrgNotificationTopicStatus :: Lens' ModifyReplicationGroup (Maybe Text)

-- | Specifies the weekly time range during which maintenance on the cache
--   cluster is performed. It is specified as a range in the format
--   ddd:hh24:mi-ddd:hh24:mi (24H Clock UTC). The minimum maintenance
--   window is a 60 minute period. Valid values for <tt>ddd</tt> are:
--   
--   <tt>sun</tt> <tt>mon</tt> <tt>tue</tt> <tt>wed</tt> <tt>thu</tt>
--   <tt>fri</tt> <tt>sat</tt> Example: 'sun:05:00-sun:09:00'
mrgPreferredMaintenanceWindow :: Lens' ModifyReplicationGroup (Maybe Text)

-- | If this parameter is specified, ElastiCache will promote each of the
--   cache clusters in the specified replication group to the primary role.
--   The nodes of all other cache clusters in the replication group will be
--   read replicas.
mrgPrimaryClusterId :: Lens' ModifyReplicationGroup (Maybe Text)

-- | A description for the replication group. Maximum length is 255
--   characters.
mrgReplicationGroupDescription :: Lens' ModifyReplicationGroup (Maybe Text)

-- | The identifier of the replication group to modify.
mrgReplicationGroupId :: Lens' ModifyReplicationGroup Text

-- | Specifies the VPC Security Groups associated with the cache clusters
--   in the replication group.
--   
--   This parameter can be used only with replication group containing
--   cache clusters running in an Amazon Virtual Private Cloud (VPC).
mrgSecurityGroupIds :: Lens' ModifyReplicationGroup [Text]

-- | The number of days for which ElastiCache will retain automatic node
--   group snapshots before deleting them. For example, if you set
--   <i>SnapshotRetentionLimit</i> to 5, then a snapshot that was taken
--   today will be retained for 5 days before being deleted.
--   
--   Important If the value of SnapshotRetentionLimit is set to zero (0),
--   backups are turned off.
mrgSnapshotRetentionLimit :: Lens' ModifyReplicationGroup (Maybe Int)

-- | The daily time range (in UTC) during which ElastiCache will begin
--   taking a daily snapshot of the node group specified by
--   <i>SnapshottingClusterId</i>.
--   
--   Example: '05:00-09:00'
--   
--   If you do not specify this parameter, then ElastiCache will
--   automatically choose an appropriate time range.
mrgSnapshotWindow :: Lens' ModifyReplicationGroup (Maybe Text)

-- | The cache cluster ID that will be used as the daily snapshot source
--   for the replication group.
mrgSnapshottingClusterId :: Lens' ModifyReplicationGroup (Maybe Text)
data ModifyReplicationGroupResponse

-- | <a>ModifyReplicationGroupResponse</a> constructor.
--   
--   The fields accessible through corresponding lenses are:
--   
--   <ul>
--   <li><a>mrgrReplicationGroup</a> <tt>::</tt> <a>Maybe</a>
--   <a>ReplicationGroup</a></li>
--   </ul>
modifyReplicationGroupResponse :: ModifyReplicationGroupResponse
mrgrReplicationGroup :: Lens' ModifyReplicationGroupResponse (Maybe ReplicationGroup)
instance Eq ModifyReplicationGroup
instance Ord ModifyReplicationGroup
instance Read ModifyReplicationGroup
instance Show ModifyReplicationGroup
instance Eq ModifyReplicationGroupResponse
instance Read ModifyReplicationGroupResponse
instance Show ModifyReplicationGroupResponse
instance FromXML ModifyReplicationGroupResponse
instance AWSRequest ModifyReplicationGroup
instance ToHeaders ModifyReplicationGroup
instance ToQuery ModifyReplicationGroup
instance ToPath ModifyReplicationGroup


-- | The <i>ModifyCacheSubnetGroup</i> action modifies an existing cache
--   subnet group.
--   
--   
--   <a>http://docs.aws.amazon.com/AmazonElastiCache/latest/APIReference/API_ModifyCacheSubnetGroup.html</a>
module Network.AWS.ElastiCache.ModifyCacheSubnetGroup
data ModifyCacheSubnetGroup

-- | <a>ModifyCacheSubnetGroup</a> constructor.
--   
--   The fields accessible through corresponding lenses are:
--   
--   <ul>
--   <li><a>mcsgCacheSubnetGroupDescription</a> <tt>::</tt> <a>Maybe</a>
--   <a>Text</a></li>
--   <li><a>mcsgCacheSubnetGroupName</a> <tt>::</tt> <a>Text</a></li>
--   <li><a>mcsgSubnetIds</a> <tt>::</tt> [<a>Text</a>]</li>
--   </ul>
modifyCacheSubnetGroup :: Text -> ModifyCacheSubnetGroup

-- | A description for the cache subnet group.
mcsgCacheSubnetGroupDescription :: Lens' ModifyCacheSubnetGroup (Maybe Text)

-- | The name for the cache subnet group. This value is stored as a
--   lowercase string.
--   
--   Constraints: Must contain no more than 255 alphanumeric characters or
--   hyphens.
--   
--   Example: <tt>mysubnetgroup</tt>
mcsgCacheSubnetGroupName :: Lens' ModifyCacheSubnetGroup Text

-- | The EC2 subnet IDs for the cache subnet group.
mcsgSubnetIds :: Lens' ModifyCacheSubnetGroup [Text]

-- | The <i>ModifyCacheParameterGroup</i> action modifies the parameters of
--   a cache parameter group. You can modify up to 20 parameters in a
--   single request by submitting a list parameter name and value pairs.
--   
--   
--   <a>http://docs.aws.amazon.com/AmazonElastiCache/latest/APIReference/API_ModifyCacheParameterGroup.html</a>
module Network.AWS.ElastiCache.ModifyCacheParameterGroup
data ModifyCacheParameterGroup

-- | <a>ModifyCacheParameterGroup</a> constructor.
--   
--   The fields accessible through corresponding lenses are:
--   
--   <ul>
--   <li><a>mcpgCacheParameterGroupName</a> <tt>::</tt> <a>Text</a></li>
--   <li><a>mcpgParameterNameValues</a> <tt>::</tt>
--   [<a>ParameterNameValue</a>]</li>
--   </ul>
modifyCacheParameterGroup :: Text -> ModifyCacheParameterGroup

-- | The name of the cache parameter group to modify.
mcpgCacheParameterGroupName :: Lens' ModifyCacheParameterGroup Text

-- | An array of parameter names and values for the parameter update. You
--   must supply at least one parameter name and value; subsequent
--   arguments are optional. A maximum of 20 parameters may be modified per
--   request.
mcpgParameterNameValues :: Lens' ModifyCacheParameterGroup [ParameterNameValue]
data ModifyCacheParameterGroupResponse

-- | <a>ModifyCacheParameterGroupResponse</a> constructor.
--   
--   The fields accessible through corresponding lenses are:
--   
--   <ul>
--   <li><a>mcpgrCacheParameterGroupName</a> <tt>::</tt> <a>Maybe</a>
--   <a>Text</a></li>
--   </ul>
modifyCacheParameterGroupResponse :: ModifyCacheParameterGroupResponse

mcpgrCacheParameterGroupName :: Lens' ModifyCacheParameterGroupResponse (Maybe Text)
instance Eq ModifyCacheParameterGroup
instance Read ModifyCacheParameterGroup
